data.title: Campus & Student Life at Lane College
data.meta_description: Do freshmen need to live on campus? What is the ethnic diversity like at Lane College? Is the college located near city hotspots in Tennessee or is it in sleepy suburbia? Find out at CollegeFactual.com.
data.text:
Home to about 1,095 undergraduates in 2020, Lane College is a small, private college located in Jackson, Tennessee. This urban setting might be best suited for students who like the fast-paced city life. Please note, some classes/degrees offered by Lane College can be taken âonlineâ so keep that in mind when reviewing this report. For more context, you might also check out our Lane College Guide to Distance and Online Learning.

Lane College is an "Historically Black College or University" (HBCU)

The Higher Education Act of 1965 established historically black colleges and universities as institutions whose principal mission was the education of African-Americans. Today, the HBCU designation does not necessitate that Lane College is exclusively or even predominantly African-American (though it currently is). Thanks to integration efforts, there are HBCUs with non-black majorities and non-HBCUs with black majorities. For more information you can review the White House Initiative on Historically Black Colleges and Universities.

Lane College is Affiliated With the Christian Methodist Episcopal Faith.

Some, but not all, schools with a religious affiliation may require a statement of faith or religious studies component. Contact the school to see what their requirements are. If an affinity with the Christian Methodist Episcopal faith interests you, check out our ranking of The Best Christian Methodist Episcopal Colleges and Universities.

Lane College Has a Disability Services Site

For more information on policies and accommodations that the college provides to ensure all students get the opportunity to participate, you can visit Lane College Disability Services.

Lane College for the Military

While not a "service academy", Lane College does offer support for veterans and those seeking a career in the armed forces. Undergraduates have access to one or more ROTC programs. For more information on policies related to veterans, you can visit Lane College Veteran Services . For more information, check out our Lane College for Veterans Guide.

Freshmen Living Arrangements at Lane College

Lane College offers on-campus housing, but freshmen are not required to take advantage of it. In the end though, most do choose to live in the dorms.

* Data compiled from students who received financial aid, including loans.

Full-time vs. Part-time Studies at Lane College

Lane College has a comparatively small, student body. There were 1,095 undergraduates in 2020. Full-time attendance was 1,048 (95.7%). Part-time attendance was 47 (4.3%).

Full-timePart-timeTotal1,048471,095

Lane College is Ranked #1,523 for Overall Diversity

Compared to other colleges and universities across the nation, Lane College is about average in terms of overall diversity. We rank Lane CollegeÂ #1523 out of 3,451.

The chart below shows each element that we looked at to determine this ranking, and how that metric compares to the national average. 100 would indicate excellent diversity in each category, and 1 would mean poor diversity.

You can learn more about the diversity of the student body at Lane College by looking closer at the ethnic,Â gender,Â age, and geographic diversity metrics from the Lane College Diversity Guide.

Lane College Competes in the NCAA

Lane College has a total of 264 student athletes, 189 men and 75 women who compete in inter-collegiate athletics.
